clues.clue: The ribbon cutting to commence the fair took place here.
clues.hint: You probably entered the fair by going across this point.

clues.clue: Now PREPare to witness some young talent on this stage.
clues.hint: The clubs in this tent are aimed at grades K-3.

clues.clue: Which club made this app and this scavenger hunt?
clues.hint: It's written in the app settings.

clues.clue: Come & get a combination platter of music & munchies!
clues.hint: This 4-H run food tent plays music while you enjoy your treats.

clues.clue: The buzz is that the green is growing here in 4-H.
clues.hint: If you plant these in a ___ they can be pollinated by ___.

clues.clue: Hop on down to find these cute, small, and fuzzy friends.
clues.hint: They are common household pets but you still might find them in your backyard.
This animal is commonly a pet or emotional support animal, known as "man's best friend".

clues.clue: The oldest club in Somerset County that has the biggest clover.
clues.hint: The clover is made out of milk bottles.

clues.clue: This ruminant animal's heart weighs about the size of a baseball (7 oz).
clues.hint: It has horns and likes to eat a lot of plants.

clues.clue: Which tent has a peep show?
clues.hint: This animal can be found on a farm laying eggs.

clues.clue: Where could you go to figure out what's "bugging" your plants?
clues.hint: These gardeners are a ___ at their craft.

clues.clue: Some can live in the water, some on land, but some can even live on both.
clues.hint: This tent is full of scales, fins, and tails.

clues.clue: This domestic animal has the finest fiber.
You can make art with these mechanical and electrical devices.
clues.hint: Motors, gears, and wheels all go into building ___.

clues.clue: All dressed up with somewhere to go? Why are the sheep wearing coats?
clues.hint: Baa! Ram! Ewe! Baa! Ram! Ewe! Looking for wool...

clues.clue: The hands are the stars of this show.
clues.hint: This stage has small shows with small actors. Well, cloth-covered hands.
